perform.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to do something to entertain people, for example by acting a play or playing a piece of music
perform.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Chenier and the band are performing at the Silver Palace tomorrow.
The children perform two plays each school year.
perform.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to do something, especially something difficult or useful
perform.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: The official opening ceremony was performed by Princess Margaret.
The leadership cannot be expected to perform miracles (=improve a situation in a way that seems impossible).
An analysis of the survey data was performed.
She was fired for not performing the duties outlined in her contract.
software that performs a specific function
perform.translation[0].definitions[1].no: In everyday English, people usually say that someone carries out an operation, a study etc rather than use perform:
The operation was carried out by a team of surgeons.
perform.translation[0].note_box[0].headi: – Meaning 2: to do something, especially something difficult or useful
perform.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: What skills do you need to perform this task?
Over 6,000 people in our community of 100,000 perform volunteer work.
Part of the Chemistry exam involves performing an experiment.
The surgeon who performed the operation said it had gone well.
At 3 o'clock, the opening ceremony was performed by the Queen.
Our troops are performing a remarkable service and a terribly important mission.
The two organizations perform similar functions.
The children sing and perform the actions to nursery songs.
I'm prepared to work hard to get the job done but I can't perform miracles.
perform.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to do work, carry out a duty, task etc
perform.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: It takes a highly skilled mechanic to perform repairs on this car.
Symbols across the top of the screen let a user click a mouse button to perform common operations such as adding up a column of figures.
These chips are designed to perform very specific functions, such as controlling computer disk drives.
perform.translation[1].definitions[1].de: to do what is expected or wanted
perform.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: She looked good during the interview, but will she perform once she’s in the job?
The company’s three divisions allperformed well, despite the recession.
